description: Innovative crafters who blend magic and technology to create magical items and devices. Masters of invention who infuse mundane objects with arcane power.
weapon_proficiency: Simple weapons, firearms (if available), light crossbows, heavy crossbows
tool_proficiency: Thieves' tools, tinker's tools, one type of artisan's tools

key_features.name: Magical Tinkering
key_features.description: Create tiny magical objects that produce minor effects

key_features.name: Infuse Item
key_features.description: Imbue mundane items with magical properties

key_features.name: Spellcasting
key_features.description: Half-caster using tools as spellcasting focus

key_features.name: Tool Expertise
key_features.description: Double proficiency bonus with tool checks

alabastria_lore: In the volcanic forges of Alatman and the mountain workshops of Maltman, Artificers represent the pinnacle of magical engineering. These innovative creators bridge the gap between ancient magic and emerging technology, crafting wonders that aid adventurers and defend settlements across Kamalatman.
playstyle: Versatile support character who excels at problem-solving through magical items and utility spells. Best for players who enjoy creative solutions and helping the party with magical gadgets.

subclasses.name: Alchemist
subclasses.description: Masters of magical chemistry who brew potions and elixirs to heal allies and harm enemies.

key_features.name: Experimental Elixir
key_features.description: Create random beneficial potions each day

key_features.name: Healing Word
key_features.description: Always prepared spell for emergency healing

key_features.name: Alchemical Savant
key_features.description: Add INT modifier to spell damage and healing

subclasses.alabastria_context: In Kuriguer's coastal towns, Gnome Alchemists work alongside Deep Gnomes from Maltman's underground laboratories, creating miraculous healing draughts and explosive compounds. Their workshops fill the air with colorful smoke and the promise of magical discovery.
subclasses.playstyle: Support-focused healer and utility caster. Perfect for players who want to be the party's medic while contributing unique magical solutions.

subclasses.name: Armorer
subclasses.description: Creators of magical armor who turn their own body into a walking fortress or stealth suit.

key_features.name: Arcane Armor
key_features.description: Transform armor into magical suit with special properties

key_features.name: Armor Model
key_features.description: Choose between Guardian (tank) or Infiltrator (stealth) modes

key_features.name: Extra Attack
key_features.description: Make two attacks when you take the Attack action

subclasses.alabastria_context: Warforged Armorers in Alatman's volcanic forges create living armor that adapts to any situation. Dwarven Armorers in Maltman craft traditional but magically enhanced suits, while Hobgoblin Armorers in Bulsania focus on military applications.
subclasses.playstyle: Tanky front-line fighter or stealthy infiltrator. Great for players who want to be heavily armored but still have magical utility.

subclasses.name: Artillerist
subclasses.description: Experts in explosive magic and ranged combat who create magical turrets and enhance projectiles.

key_features.name: Eldritch Cannons
key_features.description: Create magical turrets for offense, defense, or support

key_features.name: Arcane Firearm
key_features.description: Enhanced damage with artificer spells using wands or rods

key_features.name: Explosive Cannon
key_features.description: Sacrifice cannons for explosive damage

subclasses.alabastria_context: Rock Gnome Artillerists in Kuriguer's innovative coastal cities develop siege weapons that blend magic with mechanical precision. In Bulsania's icy fortresses, Hobgoblin Artillerists create devastating weapons to defend against the harsh frontier.
subclasses.playstyle: Ranged damage dealer with battlefield control. Ideal for players who enjoy tactical positioning and dealing consistent damage from afar.

subclasses.name: Battle Smith
subclasses.description: Warrior-inventors who combine martial prowess with magical constructs, accompanied by a steel defender.

key_features.name: Steel Defender
key_features.description: Mechanical companion that fights alongside you

key_features.name: Battle Ready
key_features.description: Use INT for weapon attacks and gain martial weapon proficiency

key_features.name: Extra Attack
key_features.description: Make two attacks when you take the Attack action

subclasses.alabastria_context: Warforged Battle Smiths in Alatman understand construct creation intimately, crafting loyal steel defenders. Gnome Battle Smiths in Kuriguer combine inventive genius with combat necessity, while Human Battle Smiths in Skratonia adapt these techniques for city defense.
subclasses.playstyle: Versatile warrior with a loyal companion. Perfect for players who want to fight in melee while having a pet and magical utility.

description: Fierce warriors who harness primal fury and instinct to become devastating forces in battle. They draw strength from rage and their connection to the wild.

key_features.name: Rage
key_features.description: Enter a battle fury for damage bonus and damage resistance

key_features.name: Unarmored Defense

key_features.name: Reckless Attack
key_features.description: Gain advantage on attacks but enemies have advantage against you

key_features.name: Extra Attack
key_features.description: Make two attacks when you take the Attack action

alabastria_lore: From the frozen peaks of Bulsania to the swampy strongholds of Katman, Barbarians embody the untamed spirit of Alabastria's wildest places. These warriors reject civilization's constraints, drawing power from ancestral spirits, primal totems, and the raw fury of the natural world.
playstyle: High-damage, high-durability front-line fighter. Best for players who want to charge into battle and deal massive damage while shrugging off enemy attacks.

subclasses.name: Path of the Ancestral Guardian
subclasses.description: Barbarians who call upon the spirits of their ancestors to protect allies and hinder enemies.

key_features.name: Ancestral Protectors
key_features.description: Ancestors reduce damage to allies and hinder your targets

key_features.name: Spirit Shield
key_features.description: Use reaction to reduce damage to nearby allies

key_features.name: Consult the Spirits
key_features.description: Cast augury or clairvoyance as rituals

subclasses.alabastria_context: In Bulsania's mountain tribes, Goliath Ancestral Guardians commune with the spirits of their giant-kin ancestors. Orc tribes in Katman's swamps honor their fallen warriors, while Lizardfolk draw upon ancient reptilian memories.
subclasses.playstyle: Protective tank who shields allies while dealing damage. Great for players who want to be the party's guardian and protector.

subclasses.name: Path of the Beast
subclasses.description: Barbarians whose rage manifests as bestial transformations, growing claws, fangs, or other natural weapons.

key_features.name: Form of the Beast
key_features.description: Grow natural weapons when you rage: bite, claws, or tail

key_features.name: Bestial Soul
key_features.description: Gain climbing, swimming speed or enhanced jumping

key_features.name: Infectious Fury
key_features.description: Spread your bestial rage to allies

subclasses.alabastria_context: Shifters in Kuriguer's wild woods naturally gravitate toward this path, their lycanthropic heritage manifesting in battle. Tabaxi on Skratonia's plains embrace their feline nature, while Beasthide Shifters become living weapons.
subclasses.playstyle: Versatile melee combatant with animal-like abilities. Perfect for players who want to embody primal savagery and adaptability.

subclasses.name: Path of the Berserker
subclasses.description: Warriors who abandon all restraint in battle, becoming unstoppable forces of destruction.

key_features.name: Frenzy
key_features.description: Make additional attacks during rage but gain exhaustion

key_features.name: Mindless Rage
key_features.description: Immunity to charm and fear while raging

key_features.name: Intimidating Presence
key_features.description: Frighten enemies with your ferocity

subclasses.alabastria_context: Orc warriors in Katman's tribal strongholds embrace the berserker's path, their natural fury enhanced by swamp warfare. Goliaths in Bulsania's harsh mountains use relentless rage to survive, while Dragonborn channel draconic wrath.
subclasses.playstyle: Maximum damage output with high risk/reward mechanics. Ideal for players who want to be an unstoppable force of destruction.

subclasses.name: Path of the Storm Herald
subclasses.description: Barbarians who channel elemental forces during their rage, creating auras of destruction around them.

key_features.name: Storm Aura
key_features.description: Choose desert (fire), sea (lightning), or tundra (cold) aura effects

key_features.name: Storm Soul
key_features.description: Gain resistance and additional benefits based on your aura

key_features.name: Shielding Storm
key_features.description: Grant resistance to allies within your aura

subclasses.alabastria_context: Aarakocra Storm Heralds in Bulsania's peaks channel mountain storms and arctic winds. Air Genasi in Kuriguer embrace coastal tempests, while Goliaths manifest the fury of blizzards and avalanches.
subclasses.playstyle: Area-of-effect damage dealer who affects the battlefield around them. Great for players who want elemental powers and battlefield control.

subclasses.name: Path of the Totem Warrior
subclasses.description: Barbarians who form spiritual bonds with animal totems, gaining their traits and wisdom.

key_features.name: Totem Spirit
key_features.description: Choose bear (resistance), eagle (perception), or wolf (pack tactics) totems

key_features.name: Aspect of the Beast
key_features.description: Gain additional totem animal benefits outside of rage

key_features.name: Totemic Attunement
key_features.description: Powerful totem abilities that affect combat and exploration

subclasses.alabastria_context: Goliath tribes in Bulsania bond with mountain spirits and giant eagles. Shifters in Kuriguer connect with forest predators, while Centaurs on Skratonia's plains honor horse spirits and plains animals.
subclasses.playstyle: Versatile barbarian with nature-themed abilities. Perfect for players who want spiritual connection to animals and varied utility.

subclasses.name: Path of Wild Magic
subclasses.description: Barbarians touched by chaotic magic whose rage triggers unpredictable magical effects.

key_features.name: Magic Awareness
key_features.description: Sense magic around you as a bonus action

key_features.name: Wild Surge
key_features.description: Trigger random magical effects when you rage

key_features.name: Bolstering Magic
key_features.description: Grant spell slots or enhance ability checks for allies

subclasses.alabastria_context: Genasi in Kuriguer's magical forests experience wild surges from elemental chaos. Tieflings across Skratonia manifest infernal unpredictability, while Halflings discover their luck interacts strangely with magical forces.
subclasses.playstyle: Unpredictable barbarian with magical effects. Ideal for players who enjoy chaos and want magic mixed with martial combat.

subclasses.name: Path of the Zealot
subclasses.description: Divine warriors whose rage is fueled by religious fervor and celestial or infernal power.

key_features.name: Divine Fury
key_features.description: Deal extra radiant or necrotic damage while raging

key_features.name: Warrior of the Gods
key_features.description: Spells that restore you to life require no material components

key_features.name: Zealous Presence
key_features.description: Grant allies advantage on attacks and saving throws

subclasses.alabastria_context: Aarakocra Zealots in Bulsania serve sky gods with divine fury. Aasimar across Skratonia channel celestial rage for righteous causes, while Dragonborn embrace draconic religious fervor in their militarized society.
subclasses.playstyle: Religious warrior with divine damage and support abilities. Perfect for players who want to combine faith with fury.

subclasses.name: Path of the Battlerager
subclasses.description: Dwarven warriors who wear spiked armor and use it as a weapon, becoming whirlwinds of destruction in combat.

key_features.name: Battlerager Armor
key_features.description: Gain proficiency with spiked armor and can use it as a weapon

key_features.name: Reckless Abandon
key_features.description: Gain temporary hit points when you use Reckless Attack

key_features.name: Battlerager Charge
key_features.description: Charge into battle, dealing damage and knocking enemies prone

subclasses.alabastria_context: Battleragers in Alabastria are primarily found among the dwarven strongholds of Bulsania, where their aggressive fighting style is both feared and respected. They often serve as elite shock troops in the Icebound Confederacy.
subclasses.playstyle: Aggressive tank who uses armor as a weapon. Perfect for players who want to be a mobile, damaging tank.

subclasses.name: Path of the Giant
subclasses.description: Barbarians who channel the power of giants, growing in size and strength as they rage, becoming towering forces of destruction.

key_features.name: Giant's Might
key_features.description: Grow to Large size when you rage, gaining reach and damage bonuses

key_features.name: Elemental Cleaver
key_features.description: Infuse your attacks with elemental damage based on your chosen giant type

key_features.name: Mighty Impel
key_features.description: Throw enemies or objects with incredible force, dealing damage and knocking them back

subclasses.alabastria_context: Giant barbarians in Alabastria often trace their lineage to the ancient giants who once roamed the mountains of Bulsania and the peaks of Kamalatman. Their connection to these primordial beings gives them incredible strength and size.
subclasses.playstyle: Size-changing warrior with area control and massive damage. Great for players who want to be a huge, intimidating presence on the battlefield.

subclasses.name: Path of Wild Magic
subclasses.description: Barbarians touched by chaotic magic whose rage triggers unpredictable magical effects, creating both opportunities and dangers.

key_features.name: Magic Awareness
key_features.description: Sense magic around you as a bonus action and gain advantage on saving throws against spells

key_features.name: Wild Surge
key_features.description: Trigger random magical effects when you rage, from beneficial to dangerous

key_features.name: Bolstering Magic
key_features.description: Grant spell slots or enhance ability checks for allies through your wild magic

subclasses.alabastria_context: Wild Magic barbarians in Alabastria are often found in the magical anomalies of Kuriguer, where the chaotic magic of the forests has touched their souls. They are both feared and sought after for their unpredictable power.
subclasses.playstyle: Chaotic warrior with unpredictable magical effects. Perfect for players who enjoy randomness and magical mayhem.

description: Versatile performers who weave magic through music, stories, and performance. Masters of inspiration who support allies and control the battlefield through charm and wit.
weapon_proficiency: Simple weapons, hand crossbows, longswords, rapiers, shortswords
tool_proficiency: Three musical instruments of your choice

key_features.name: Spellcasting
key_features.description: Full caster with access to spells from any class

key_features.name: Bardic Inspiration
key_features.description: Grant allies bonus dice to add to their rolls

key_features.name: Jack of All Trades
key_features.description: Add half proficiency bonus to non-proficient ability checks

key_features.name: Expertise
key_features.description: Double proficiency bonus for chosen skills

alabastria_lore: In Skratonia's diverse city-states and Kuriguer's magical courts, Bards serve as diplomats, entertainers, and keepers of lore. Their songs preserve the history of The Bringing, weave magic through performance, and inspire heroes across all continents of Alabastria.
playstyle: Ultimate support character with unmatched versatility. Best for players who enjoy helping others succeed and having options for every situation.

subclasses.name: College of Creation
subclasses.description: Bards who use the Song of Creation to bring objects and creatures into existence through performance.

key_features.name: Note of Potential
key_features.description: Bardic Inspiration dice can trigger additional effects

key_features.name: Performance of Creation
key_features.description: Create nonmagical items through performance

key_features.name: Animating Performance
key_features.description: Bring objects to life as dancing companions

subclasses.alabastria_context: Satyr Bards in Kuriguer's fey glades channel creation magic through revelry and song. Half-Elf Bards in Skratonia use their versatile nature to bridge different artistic traditions, while Fairy Bards create wonder through miniature performances.
subclasses.playstyle: Creative support with unique utility options. Great for players who want to solve problems through magical creativity.

subclasses.name: College of Eloquence
subclasses.description: Masters of speech and persuasion who can sway minds and guarantee their words have impact.

key_features.name: Silver Tongue
key_features.description: Treat low rolls on Deception and Persuasion as 10s

key_features.name: Unsettling Words
key_features.description: Use Bardic Inspiration to reduce enemy saving throws

key_features.name: Universal Speech
key_features.description: Make any creature understand your speech

subclasses.alabastria_context: Half-Elf diplomats in Skratonia's council chambers master eloquence to bridge cultural divides. Aasimar speakers inspire through celestial wisdom, while Human politicians navigate complex city-state relationships.
subclasses.playstyle: Social manipulation and guaranteed success. Perfect for players who want to excel in roleplay and social encounters.

subclasses.name: College of Glamour
subclasses.description: Bards touched by fey magic who use supernatural beauty and charm to entrance and command.

key_features.name: Mantle of Inspiration
key_features.description: Grant allies temporary hit points and movement

key_features.name: Enthralling Performance
key_features.description: Charm creatures through extended performance

key_features.name: Mantle of Majesty
key_features.description: Cast command as a bonus action while concentrating on enchantment

subclasses.alabastria_context: Eladrin Bards in Kuriguer's magic groves embody seasonal glamour and fey beauty. Satyr performers captivate audiences with supernatural charisma, while Tiefling Bards use infernal allure for darker purposes.
subclasses.playstyle: Enchantment-focused controller with fey magic. Ideal for players who want to charm enemies and inspire allies with supernatural presence.

subclasses.name: College of Lore
subclasses.description: Scholars and knowledge-seekers who collect secrets and magical techniques from across the world.

key_features.name: Cutting Words
key_features.description: Use Bardic Inspiration to reduce enemy attack, ability, and damage rolls

key_features.name: Additional Magical Secrets
key_features.description: Learn spells from any class earlier than other bards

key_features.name: Peerless Skill
key_features.description: Add half your proficiency bonus to Bardic Inspiration

subclasses.alabastria_context: Human scholars in Skratonia's libraries preserve knowledge from all continents. Half-Elf researchers bridge different cultural traditions, while Vedalken academics approach lore with systematic precision.
subclasses.playstyle: Ultimate versatility with access to any spell. Perfect for players who want maximum options and knowledge-based roleplay.

subclasses.name: College of Spirits
subclasses.description: Bards who commune with spirits and channel their stories for magical effects.

key_features.name: Guiding Whispers
key_features.description: Bardic Inspiration can be used on Wisdom or Charisma checks

key_features.name: Spirit Session
key_features.description: Channel spirits for random magical effects

key_features.name: Tales from Beyond
key_features.description: Use Bardic Inspiration to trigger specific spirit effects

subclasses.alabastria_context: Shadar-kai Bards in Kuriguer's dangerous woods commune with shadow spirits. Reborn individuals in Skratonia channel memories of past lives, while Hexblood Bards speak with spirits touched by hag magic.
subclasses.playstyle: Unpredictable support with spiritual themes. Great for players who enjoy ghostly lore and random magical effects.

subclasses.name: College of Swords
subclasses.description: Warrior-poets who combine bladework with performance, fighting with artistic flair.

key_features.name: Fighting Style
key_features.description: Choose Dueling or Two-Weapon Fighting

key_features.name: Blade Flourish
key_features.description: Use Bardic Inspiration for special attack effects

key_features.name: Extra Attack
key_features.description: Make two attacks when you take the Attack action

subclasses.alabastria_context: Half-Elf duelists in Skratonia's urban centers blend combat with performance art. Tabaxi blade dancers on the plains combine feline grace with swordplay, while Human sword-singers adapt techniques from multiple traditions.
subclasses.playstyle: Melee-focused bard with combat prowess. Perfect for players who want to fight up close while maintaining bardic versatility.

subclasses.name: College of Valor
subclasses.description: Battle-bards who inspire courage in combat and fight alongside their allies.

key_features.name: Combat Inspiration
key_features.description: Bardic Inspiration can add to weapon damage or AC

key_features.name: Medium Armor and Shields
key_features.description: Proficiency with medium armor, shields, and martial weapons

key_features.name: Extra Attack
key_features.description: Make two attacks when you take the Attack action

subclasses.alabastria_context: Dragonborn war-singers in Bulsania's militarized society inspire troops with draconic battle hymns. Human valor bards lead Skratonia's city militias, while Leonin pride-singers rally their warrior communities.
subclasses.playstyle: Balanced combat and support character. Ideal for players who want to fight effectively while inspiring allies.

subclasses.name: College of Whispers
subclasses.description: Spies and manipulators who use secrets and psychic magic to control and deceive.

key_features.name: Psychic Blades
key_features.description: Use Bardic Inspiration to deal psychic damage

key_features.name: Words of Terror
key_features.description: Frighten creatures through whispered secrets

key_features.name: Mantle of Whispers
key_features.description: Capture and use the shadows of humanoids

subclasses.alabastria_context: Changeling spies in Kuriguer's diverse ports use their shapeshifting with whispered secrets. Kenku information brokers excel at gathering and trading secrets, while Tiefling manipulators work in Skratonia's political shadows.
subclasses.playstyle: Espionage and psychological warfare. Perfect for players who want to be the party's spy and manipulator.

description: Divine agents who channel the power of their deities to heal, protect, and smite enemies. Servants of gods who wield holy magic to aid allies and punish the wicked.

key_features.name: Spellcasting
key_features.description: Full caster with access to entire cleric spell list

key_features.name: Divine Domain
key_features.description: Choose a domain that grants additional spells and abilities

key_features.name: Channel Divinity
key_features.description: Channel divine energy for powerful effects

key_features.name: Destroy Undead
key_features.description: Automatically destroy low-CR undead with Channel Divinity

alabastria_lore: Across Alabastria's diverse continents, Clerics serve as the primary connection between mortals and the divine. From Tempus-worshipping War Clerics like Tharos Raggenthraw to forge-priests in Maltman's workshops, these holy servants adapt their faith to serve their communities' needs.
playstyle: Primary healer and support with strong defensive capabilities. Best for players who want to keep the party alive while contributing meaningful combat support.

subclasses.name: Forge Domain
subclasses.description: Clerics of smithing gods who bless weapons and armor with divine power.

key_features.name: Blessing of the Forge
key_features.description: Enhance weapons or armor with +1 bonus

key_features.name: Channel Divinity: Artisan's Blessing
key_features.description: Create simple metal items through divine power

key_features.name: Soul of the Forge
key_features.description: Resistance to fire damage and +1 AC while wearing heavy armor

subclasses.alabastria_context: Dwarven Forge Clerics in Maltman's mountain strongholds serve the god of smiths and creation. Warforged clerics in Alatman understand the divine spark within constructed beings, while Duergar forge-priests work in the deepest underground workshops.
subclasses.playstyle: Tanky support focused on equipment enhancement. Perfect for players who want to craft magical items and support through divine smithing.

subclasses.name: Life Domain
subclasses.description: Healers dedicated to preserving and restoring life, the most traditional clerical role.

key_features.name: Disciple of Life
key_features.description: Healing spells restore additional hit points

key_features.name: Channel Divinity: Preserve Life
key_features.description: Heal multiple allies simultaneously

key_features.name: Blessed Healer
key_features.description: Heal yourself when you heal others with spells

subclasses.alabastria_context: Aasimar Life Clerics in Skratonia's cities serve as beacons of hope and healing. Human clerics establish temples and hospitals, while Halfling healers tend to rural communities and traveling caravans.
subclasses.playstyle: Ultimate healer focused on keeping everyone alive. Ideal for players who want to be the party's primary source of healing and support.

subclasses.name: War Domain
subclasses.description: Battle-clerics who serve gods of war and conflict, blessing warriors and leading charges.

key_features.name: War Priest
key_features.description: Make bonus action weapon attacks when casting spells

key_features.name: Channel Divinity: Guided Strike
key_features.description: Gain +10 bonus to attack rolls

key_features.name: War Domain Spells
key_features.description: Always know spells like shield, spiritual weapon, and crusader's mantle

subclasses.alabastria_context: Leonin War Clerics like Tharos Raggenthraw serve Tempus across Skratonia's warrior prides. Dragonborn battle-priests lead Bulsania's militarized forces, while Orc war-shamans rally tribal warriors in Katman's swamps.
subclasses.playstyle: Combat-focused cleric who fights on the front lines. Great for players who want to be both warrior and priest.

subclasses.name: Tempest Domain
subclasses.description: Storm-callers who channel the power of thunder, lightning, and ocean tempests.

key_features.name: Wrath of the Storm
key_features.description: Deal thunder or lightning damage to attackers

key_features.name: Channel Divinity: Destructive Wrath
key_features.description: Maximize thunder or lightning damage

key_features.name: Thunderbolt Strike
key_features.description: Push enemies when dealing lightning damage

subclasses.alabastria_context: Aarakocra Tempest Clerics in Bulsania's peaks command mountain storms and arctic winds. Triton storm-callers along Kuriguer's coasts control oceanic tempests, while Air Genasi channel coastal winds and lightning.
subclasses.playstyle: Destructive spellcaster with weather-based powers. Perfect for players who want to call down divine storms and lightning.

subclasses.name: Light Domain
subclasses.description: Clerics of light and sun gods who wield radiant energy to illuminate darkness and burn away evil.

key_features.name: Warding Flare
key_features.description: Impose disadvantage on enemy attacks as a reaction

key_features.name: Channel Divinity: Radiance of the Dawn
key_features.description: Create a burst of radiant light that damages undead and fiends

key_features.name: Potent Spellcasting
key_features.description: Add Wisdom modifier to cantrip damage

subclasses.alabastria_context: Light Clerics in Alabastria serve as beacons of hope in dark times, their radiant magic particularly effective against the undead and fiends that plague the world. They are common in Skratonia's cities and the Huntbound Order.
subclasses.playstyle: Offensive caster with radiant damage and area control. Great for players who want to be a divine blaster with utility.

subclasses.name: Nature Domain
subclasses.description: Clerics who serve nature gods, wielding the power of the natural world to protect and nurture life.

key_features.name: Acolyte of Nature
key_features.description: Learn a druid cantrip and gain proficiency with heavy armor

key_features.name: Channel Divinity: Charm Animals and Plants
key_features.description: Charm beasts and plants to aid you

key_features.name: Dampen Elements
key_features.description: Grant resistance to elemental damage to allies

subclasses.alabastria_context: Nature Clerics in Alabastria are found in the wild regions of Kuriguer and the untamed areas of Kamalatman. They serve as protectors of the natural world and guides for those who venture into dangerous wilderness.
subclasses.playstyle: Versatile caster with nature magic and elemental resistance. Perfect for players who want to combine divine power with nature magic.

subclasses.name: Trickery Domain
subclasses.description: Clerics of trickster gods who use deception, illusion, and cunning to outwit enemies and protect their allies.

key_features.name: Blessing of the Trickster
key_features.description: Grant advantage on Stealth checks to allies

key_features.name: Channel Divinity: Invoke Duplicity
key_features.description: Create an illusory duplicate of yourself

key_features.name: Cloak of Shadows
key_features.description: Turn invisible as an action

subclasses.alabastria_context: Trickery Clerics in Alabastria often serve as spies, scouts, and information gatherers. Their deceptive abilities make them valuable in the complex political landscape and dangerous missions of the Huntbound Order.
subclasses.playstyle: Stealth-focused caster with illusion magic and deception. Great for players who want to be sneaky and cunning.

description: Guardians of nature who wield primal magic and can transform into animals. Protectors of the natural world who draw power from the land itself.
armor_proficiency: Light armor, medium armor, shields (non-metal only)
weapon_proficiency: Clubs, daggers, darts, javelins, maces, quarterstaffs, scimitars, sickles, slings, spears

key_features.name: Druidcraft
key_features.description: Minor nature-based magical effects

key_features.name: Spellcasting
key_features.description: Full caster with nature and elemental spells

key_features.name: Wild Shape
key_features.description: Transform into beasts for combat and utility

key_features.name: Druid Circle
key_features.description: Choose a circle that defines your druidic focus

alabastria_lore: In Kuriguer's magical forests and Skratonia's fertile plains, Druids maintain the balance between civilization and wilderness. These primal spellcasters guard ancient groves, tend to wounded lands, and serve as bridges between the natural and civilized worlds.
playstyle: Versatile nature-based caster with shapeshifting abilities. Best for players who want to embody nature's power and have unique utility options.

subclasses.name: Circle of the Land
subclasses.description: Druids connected to specific terrains who draw additional magic from their chosen environment.

key_features.name: Bonus Cantrip
key_features.description: Learn an additional druid cantrip

key_features.name: Natural Recovery
key_features.description: Recover spell slots during short rests

key_features.name: Circle Spells
key_features.description: Additional spells based on chosen land type

subclasses.alabastria_context: Wood Elf Land Druids in Kuriguer's forests specialize in woodland magic. Centaurs on Skratonia's plains master grassland spells, while Lizardfolk in Katman's swamps command wetland magic.
subclasses.playstyle: Spell-focused druid with terrain specialization. Great for players who want maximum spellcasting power and environmental themes.

subclasses.name: Circle of the Moon
subclasses.description: Druids who excel at shapeshifting, taking more powerful beast forms for combat.

key_features.name: Combat Wild Shape
key_features.description: Use Wild Shape as a bonus action and while in beast form

key_features.name: Circle Forms

key_features.name: Primal Strike

subclasses.alabastria_context: Mentalists in Alabastria often work with the Huntbound Order's intelligence operations, using their psionic abilities to gather information and coordinate covert missions.
subclasses.playstyle: Psionic support and battlefield communication. Great for players who want to combine strategy with mental powers.

subclasses.name: Scholar
subclasses.description: Academic tacticians who study warfare, history, and enemy tactics to develop innovative strategies and countermeasures.

key_features.name: Tactical Knowledge
key_features.description: Gain extensive knowledge of enemy tactics and weaknesses

key_features.name: Research and Development
key_features.description: Develop new tactics and strategies based on historical study and analysis

key_features.name: Master Tactician
key_features.description: Apply advanced tactical knowledge to gain significant advantages in combat

subclasses.alabastria_context: Scholars in Alabastria often work in the magical academies of Kuriguer, studying ancient warfare and developing new tactics for modern threats.
subclasses.playstyle: Knowledge-based strategy and research. Ideal for players who enjoy learning about enemy types and developing counter-strategies.

subclasses.name: War Mind
subclasses.description: Combat-focused tacticians who combine martial prowess with strategic thinking, leading from the front lines.

key_features.name: Combat Analysis
key_features.description: Analyze combat situations in real-time to gain tactical advantages

key_features.name: Battlefield Presence
key_features.description: Your mere presence on the battlefield inspires and coordinates allies

key_features.name: War Leader
key_features.description: Lead by example, gaining powerful combat abilities when fighting alongside allies

subclasses.alabastria_context: War Minds in Alabastria often serve as field commanders in the Huntbound Order, leading dangerous missions and inspiring their fellow hunters to greatness.
subclasses.playstyle: Combat-focused strategy and leadership. Perfect for players who want to combine tactical thinking with martial prowess.
